intro: Hypericum humifusum subvar. adscendens, commonly known as the ascending St. John's wort, is a low-growing perennial shrub native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features upright, woody stems that can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters, often forming dense mats. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming from June to August. Its leaves are oval-shaped, opposite, and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry meadows and rocky habitats.
